required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of Vitamin B12 in Septic Shock
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase II Double Blind Randomized Controlled Trial of High Dose Vitamin B12 in Septic Shock

brief_summary.textblock: This study will randomize 30 septic shock patients to receive either a single 5 gram dose of IV vitamin B12 (Cyanokit® Meridian Medical Technologies, Columbia, MD) versus placebo in addition to standard of care to reduce vasopressor dose at 3 hours.

detailed_description.textblock: Following informed consent from patient's legally authorized representative, patients will be randomized to hydroxocobalamin or saline. Patients will have blood samples drawn up to 3 hours pre-dose and 3 hours post-dose to measure for hydrogen sulfide levels. Patients will also be followed for 3 hours after study drug infusion to monitor and record vasopressor dependence in norepinephrine-equivalent dose. Patients will then be followed through their medical record for 28 days to determine persistent organ dysfunction syndrome (PODS).

study_design_info.masking_description: Vitamin B12a is bright red and excreted in the urine. Due to this, patient allocation cannot be masked for patients or individuals who may care for them.

primary_outcome.description: Vasopressor support as documented by administered vasopressor amounts

secondary_outcome.description: Difference between pre- and post-dose hydrogen sulfide levels
Prevalence of Persistent organ dysfunction syndrome (PODS)

arm_group.description: Single IV infusion administered over a 10-15 minute period
Single IV saline administered over a 10-15 minute period.

intervention.description: Single IV administration of Vitamin B12

intervention.other_name: 200-250 mL of intravenous saline or dextrose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult patients at least 18 years of age
- Admitted to the Medical Intensive Care Unit (MICU) service at Froedtert Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
-
